page.title: 07Other industries in Aith
page.content: {Knitwear.}In the area there is a knitwear factory. It produces jumpers and cardigns, casual wear and sportswear. Plain and yoke garments are made, the plain bodies of the yoke jumpers are knitted in the factory and then given out to people to knit in the yoke by hand in their homes. 85% of the products go to the U.S.A. and the rest goes to countries such as Britain, Germany, France and Spain. The garments are kitted on electric-powered machines. Five people work in the factory of whom two live in the area. {Salmon.}Salmon-farming is a growing industry. The young salmon are brought in from Scotland or Norway and they are kept in cages in the sea until they are big enough to sell. They must be fed three times a day.
